commit_message:
Add heal_instance_info_cache_interval to nova.conf

This attribute is not currently a part of the cookbook template.
Adding this attribute will allow operators to configure this option
which can reduce unecessary neutron requests in non OVS or Linux
Bridge deployments.

Closes-Bug:1499551

Change-Id: Ibcf6b7bb614d629926b7d1f50ac552a9d1b1e670

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-28 20:19:49.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Use 'python-jobs' in oslo.rootwrap and remove overlap

Just using the python-jobs template for oslo.rootwrap
ensures that the jobs ran are consistent with other libraries
and projects, and avoids missing jobs not being ran (for example
the check docs job).

Change-Id: I6a1cd8045ef5bb5a1cf57c5e31e5e5723075f51a
"}]
commit_message:
Use 'python-jobs' in oslo.rootwrap and remove overlap

Just using the python-jobs template for oslo.rootwrap
ensures that the jobs ran are consistent with other libraries
and projects, and avoids missing jobs not being ran (for example
the check docs job).

Change-Id: I6a1cd8045ef5bb5a1cf57c5e31e5e5723075f51a

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-24 21:01:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_masking.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vmax.py'], 'message': 'Fix VMAX live migration problem

Live migration fails for VMAX because the host is not taken into
account when determining whether a volume is masked or not. For
live migration it is necessary to know which host a volume is masked
to. This patch fixes the problem by checking which host the volume
is masked to.

Change-Id: I693e29f7b26145bd1fd357b7d98377e26bfdfed8
Closes-Bug: #1498964
'}]
commit_message:
Fix VMAX live migration problem

Live migration fails for VMAX because the host is not taken into
account when determining whether a volume is masked or not. For
live migration it is necessary to know which host a volume is masked
to. This patch fixes the problem by checking which host the volume
is masked to.

Change-Id: I693e29f7b26145bd1fd357b7d98377e26bfdfed8
Closes-Bug: #1498964

subject: Realizing SFC (1/6)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-28 14:43:22.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Realizing SFC (1/6)

This is the first step towards realizing Service Function Chaining
(SFC) in neutron. This patch addresses the required dependencies and
tox settings which is needed by the networking-sfc repository for
it's working.

Below changes are done as part of this patch-set:
 - Added dependencies in requirement.txt
 - Added dependencies in test-requirement.txt
 - Added more settings to tox.ini

Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang <cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Ic529821f68b29e0a265e3735409365eedc2cb363
"}]
commit_message:
Realizing SFC (1/6)

This is the first step towards realizing Service Function Chaining
(SFC) in neutron. This patch addresses the required dependencies and
tox settings which is needed by the networking-sfc repository for
it's working.

Below changes are done as part of this patch-set:
 - Added dependencies in requirement.txt
 - Added dependencies in test-requirement.txt
 - Added more settings to tox.ini

Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang <cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: vikram.choudhary <vikram.choudhary@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Ic529821f68b29e0a265e3735409365eedc2cb363

commit_message:
Added MAINTAINERS to top-level repo directory

In a consensus reached in a proposal for code review process
change [1], and proposed team structure policy document [2],
adding MAINTAINERS files in repositories.

Please note, that this file is written in YAML format in order
to allow further automation around code review process.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/072406.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225376/1

Change-Id: Ic5b7372ba083eb432cf98a9048fc53323a2af3d4

Devref for authorization policies enforcement

This patch adds a policy.rst document which describes how the
neutron.policy module works, how it uses oslo_policy and how
it's wired in API controllers.

The patch also remove an obsolete docstring from neutron/policy.py

midonet: Make gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-midonet non-voting

gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-midonet is broken due to the recent
MidoNet change. [1]
To fix it, there will be changes necessary for a few repositories.
As they can not be done atomically, make it non-voting for now.

subject: Enable blacklist parser to handle no comments
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-29 02:47:57.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/tests/test_os_testr.py', 'os_testr/os_testr.py'], 'message': "Enable blacklist parser to handle no comments

Currently the blacklist parser requires that the regex
file is of the form:
  regex # description of regex

It seems this isn't desirable, and folks would prefer
the ability to omit the description comment.

This patch adds a simple check of the raw line from
the blacklist_file and checks it for a comment before
trying to split on the comment symbol.

In the case of no comment, we just fill in the second
element of the resultant list with an empty string.

Change-Id: Ie4940849de322eba3220a848a79e3809d8a480fd
Closes-Bug: #1488700
"}]
commit_message:
Enable blacklist parser to handle no comments

Currently the blacklist parser requires that the regex
file is of the form:
  regex # description of regex

It seems this isn't desirable, and folks would prefer
the ability to omit the description comment.

This patch adds a simple check of the raw line from
the blacklist_file and checks it for a comment before
trying to split on the comment symbol.

In the case of no comment, we just fill in the second
element of the resultant list with an empty string.

Change-Id: Ie4940849de322eba3220a848a79e3809d8a480fd
Closes-Bug: #1488700

Tosca types need to be mapped to corresponding target translation
types (i.e. HOT). This commit allows for the target types to be
dynamically loaded from a directory. It allows for more flexibility
by pulling types from a known directory instead of defining each
individiual type statically in the code. For example, with this
commit you no longer need a separate import for each target type.

Implements: blueprint dynamic-tosca-to-hot-map

commit_message:
Allow for dynamic class loading of target types

Tosca types need to be mapped to corresponding target translation
types (i.e. HOT). This commit allows for the target types to be
dynamically loaded from a directory. It allows for more flexibility
by pulling types from a known directory instead of defining each
individiual type statically in the code. For example, with this
commit you no longer need a separate import for each target type.

Also, this commit adds the notion of a global configuration object
that can be shared throughout the translator. The configuration
defines the location directory for custom defined target types.
This configuration can be set by the user in the corresponding
translator/conf/translator.conf file. In the future, additional
values can be added to this configuration and the code can be
extended to support them, but only the required values were
implemented here.

Change-Id: If7b8da12eef5b8ed8a2e11b1f412203d4ed59c5a
Implements: blueprint dynamic-tosca-to-hot-map

commit_message:
LOG the Request ID's in Ironic API service

Currently generated request_id's per API call are not logged,
making it difficult for debugging. This commit logs the request-id's
generated per API request. This commit also appends the request-id
in the response header, to easy to track from other modules (eg:nova)

Change-Id: Ia8cec467340f2e98931e715973e0c9fd99923920
Partial-Bug:#1350608

commit_message:
(WIP)Improve the performance of _modify_rules() in IptablesManager

Implement a new algorithm for _modify_rules(), which reduces the
complexity from O(n^2) to O(nlogn)

Change-Id: Ia5e26a5bd76a24cbd4b9b90351ba567ea13c4061
Closes-Bug: 1352826

commit_message:
Continue conversion to volume object

The following patch updates more of the cinder code
base to use versionedobjects instead of direct DB calls.
This patch does not switch over db.volume_type_*,
db.volume_encryption_*, db.volume_glance_metadata_*,
db.volume_attachment_*, and db.volume_admin_metadata_*.
They will be switched over in subsequent patches.  Changing
them in this patch would make this patch even larger and
harder to review.  There are also direct DB calls within
drivers, and they will need to be converted by each driver
maintainer.

Change-Id: I77bf0d57744f6d5d38ade889e46b891accc996f9
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

subject: Fix error on deleting a policy
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-28 03:16:02.000000000', 'files': ['congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py'], 'message': 'Fix error on deleting a policy

On congress service startup, all the policies are loaded into
self.theory using persistent_load_policies. But, the policies
are not created(loaded again) with id attribute. Hence, causing
the error. This commit fixes the same.

Change-Id: I98ec13433710ca3bacb64b1d1d50551416ca902d
Partial-Bug:#1499274
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error on deleting a policy

On congress service startup, all the policies are loaded into
self.theory using persistent_load_policies. But, the policies
are not created(loaded again) with id attribute. Hence, causing
the error. This commit fixes the same.

Change-Id: I98ec13433710ca3bacb64b1d1d50551416ca902d
Partial-Bug:#1499274

Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Store all compatible plugins in 'cluster_plugins'

In order to fix a bunch of plugin management bottlenecks in Fuel,
we need to restructure our database schema first. This patch is
going to do all needed changes.

* store all compatible with some cluster plugins in the
  'cluster_plugins' table;
* introduce the 'enabled' column that tells whether plugin's enabled
  for particular cluster or not;
* push cluster-plugin connection on cluster creation and/or plugin
  installation;

Change-Id: I260386976eaafc2778380994096d22f76deea164
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

commit_message:
Use HTTP to download kernel and initital RAM disk from cobbler

As of version 3.70 (Fuel uses 4.02) pxelinux can download files
via HTTP.

DHCP option 210 sets prefix for all files that pxelinux downloads.

Change-Id: Ia2cd3a816ad084f49b9f5902570054981e59190e
Closes-Bug: #1330938
Closes-Bug: #1386861

commit_message:
Forbid creating volume from image which size is 0

Now in cinder, creating volume from image which size is 0 will be
successful, but this kind of volume is useless since there is no
image data in it. So this patch will forbid creating this volume
when image's size is 0.

APIImpact
Create volume from image which size is 0 will disallow.

Change-Id: Id4cf0bfd0da9be79e0a2f3f2284ce8027ade93c7
Closes-Bug: #1479613

According to discussion
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-March/059068.html
and the spec already suggested a method right after the
deleted parts as :
  def show(self, req, id):
    .... stuff ....
    if req.ver_obj.matches(start_version, end_version):
      .... Do version specific stuff ....

commit_message:
Delete version specified code suggestion

According to discussion
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-March/059068.html
and the spec already suggested a method right after the
deleted parts as :
  def show(self, req, id):
    .... stuff ....
    if req.ver_obj.matches(start_version, end_version):
      .... Do version specific stuff ....
    ....  stuff ....

we don't need to suggest the method in the spec any more.

There are some usage still refer to this bp, so we need change it.

Change-Id: I791860ec071ad947144f4e322e9f400fac6b81b8

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-28 16:16:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix live-migrations usage of the wrong connector information

During the post_live_migration step for the Nova libvirt driver
an incorrect assumption is being made about the connector
information being sent to _disconnect_volume. It is assumed that
the connection information on the source and destination is the
same but that is not always the case. The BDM, where the
connector information is being retrieved from only contains the
connection information for the destination. This will not work
when trying to disconnect volumes from the source during live
migration as the properties such as the target_lun and
initiator_target_map could be different. This ends up leaving
behind dangling LUNs and possibly removing the incorrect
volume's LUNs.

The solution proposed here utilizes the connection_info that
can be retrieved for a host from Cinder's initialize_connection
API. This connection information contains the correct data for
the source host and allows volume LUNs to be removed properly.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the tests being moved
in Kilo and 41f80226e0a1f73af76c7968617ebfda0aeb40b1 not being
in stable/juno (renamed conn var to drvr in libvirt tests).

Change-Id: I3dfb75eb58dfbc66b218bcee473af4c2ac282eb6
Closes-Bug: #1475411
Closes-Bug: #1288039
Closes-Bug: #1423772
(cherry picked from commit 587092c909e15e983f7aef31d7bc0862271a32c7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix live-migrations usage of the wrong connector information

During the post_live_migration step for the Nova libvirt driver
an incorrect assumption is being made about the connector
information being sent to _disconnect_volume. It is assumed that
the connection information on the source and destination is the
same but that is not always the case. The BDM, where the
connector information is being retrieved from only contains the
connection information for the destination. This will not work
when trying to disconnect volumes from the source during live
migration as the properties such as the target_lun and
initiator_target_map could be different. This ends up leaving
behind dangling LUNs and possibly removing the incorrect
volume's LUNs.

The solution proposed here utilizes the connection_info that
can be retrieved for a host from Cinder's initialize_connection
API. This connection information contains the correct data for
the source host and allows volume LUNs to be removed properly.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the tests being moved
in Kilo and 41f80226e0a1f73af76c7968617ebfda0aeb40b1 not being
in stable/juno (renamed conn var to drvr in libvirt tests).

Change-Id: I3dfb75eb58dfbc66b218bcee473af4c2ac282eb6
Closes-Bug: #1475411
Closes-Bug: #1288039
Closes-Bug: #1423772
(cherry picked from commit 587092c909e15e983f7aef31d7bc0862271a32c7)

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-09-28 20:10:48.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/inventory/multinode', 'ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'etc/kolla/config/ironic/ironic-conductor.conf', 'ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/ironic-check.yml', 'docker/ironic/ironic-discoverd/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/site.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic-pxe.json.j2', 'ansible/inventory/all-in-one', 'ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2', 'docker/ironic/ironic-discoverd/config-external.sh', 'ansible/roles/ironic/meta/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/templates/discoverd.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/bootstrap.yml', 'etc/kolla/config/discoverd.conf', 'etc/kolla/config/ironic/discoverd.conf', 'docker/ironic/ironic-api/start.sh', 'etc/kolla/config/ironic/ironic-api.conf', 'docker/ironic/ironic-pxe/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/config.yml', 'etc/kolla/config/ironic.conf', 'docker/ironic/ironic-base/Dockerfile.j2', 'tests/test_build.py', 'docker/ironic/ironic-pxe/start.sh', 'docker/ironic/ironic-conductor/config-external.sh', 'docker/ironic/ironic-conductor/start.sh', 'etc/kolla/passwords.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic-discoverd.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/start.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic-api.json.j2', 'docker/ironic/ironic-discoverd/start.sh', 'docker/ironic/ironic-api/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/roles/ironic/templates/ironic-conductor.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/neutron/templates/ml2_conf.ini.j2', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/ironic/defaults/main.yml', 'doc/ironic-guide.rst', 'ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/register.yml', 'docker/ironic/ironic-conductor/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Add Ansible support for Ironic

Configuration based off upstream documentation here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/install-guide.html

A few notes:
-ironic-api is not configured to use mod_wsgi
-several places it's noted that discoverd is going away and needs to be
replaced with ironic-inspector - (sqlite connection should be changed
too)
-currently enabling ironic reconfigures nova compute (driver and
scheduler) as well as changes neutron network settings
-a nice enhancement would be to configure the web console

Required post-deployment configuration:

Create the flat network to launch the instances:

neutron net-create --tenant-id $TENANT_ID sharednet1 --shared \
--provider:network_type flat --provider:physical_network physnet1

neutron subnet-create sharednet1 $NETWORK_CIDR --name $SUBNET_NAME \
--ip-version=4 --gateway=$GATEWAY_IP --allocation-pool \
start=$START_IP,end=$END_IP --enable-dhcp

And then the above ID is used to set cleaning_network_uuid in the neutron
section of ironic.conf.

Change-Id: I572e7ff1f23c4e57a2c50817cafe9269fd9950dd
Implements: blueprint ironic-container
"}]
commit_message:
Add Ansible support for Ironic

Configuration based off upstream documentation here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/deploy/install-guide.html

A few notes:
-ironic-api is not configured to use mod_wsgi
-several places it's noted that discoverd is going away and needs to be
replaced with ironic-inspector - (sqlite connection should be changed
too)
-currently enabling ironic reconfigures nova compute (driver and
scheduler) as well as changes neutron network settings
-a nice enhancement would be to configure the web console

Required post-deployment configuration:

Create the flat network to launch the instances:

neutron net-create --tenant-id $TENANT_ID sharednet1 --shared \
--provider:network_type flat --provider:physical_network physnet1

neutron subnet-create sharednet1 $NETWORK_CIDR --name $SUBNET_NAME \
--ip-version=4 --gateway=$GATEWAY_IP --allocation-pool \
start=$START_IP,end=$END_IP --enable-dhcp

And then the above ID is used to set cleaning_network_uuid in the neutron
section of ironic.conf.

Change-Id: I572e7ff1f23c4e57a2c50817cafe9269fd9950dd
Implements: blueprint ironic-container

commit_message:
Collect DStat CSV logs if they exist.

Future work toward visualization of DevStack and devstack-gate
performance would benefit greatly from the availability of machine-
parsable DStat output. This patch adds the additional CSV logfile
generated by DStat to the saved $BASE/logs/ directory for archival.

Change-Id: I534fb1f9356a7948d2fec0aecc7f275e47362a11

Previously, redhat-common/pre-install.d/15-remove-grub would
explicitly remove the grub packages, with a note that they are
re-installed in vm/finalize.d/51-bootloader. The removal was taken
out in e42066d68512fb4c74c54b34699aa6cd2a6fb5eb which has caused
the centos7 element to fail to build because we're now attempting
to install grub2 while it's already installed. This cleanly brings

Closes-bug: #1483385

commit_message:
Remove grub for later installation

Previously, redhat-common/pre-install.d/15-remove-grub would
explicitly remove the grub packages, with a note that they are
re-installed in vm/finalize.d/51-bootloader. The removal was taken
out in e42066d68512fb4c74c54b34699aa6cd2a6fb5eb which has caused
the centos7 element to fail to build because we're now attempting
to install grub2 while it's already installed. This cleanly brings
back the prior removal, and has been tested to work with both the
centos and fedora types.

Change-Id: I46e8efd0c6ea0417e12165b94acc6a09272aaa97
Closes-bug: #1483385

Fact caching will improve general Ansible performance by default.
This has the biggest performance gain on very large environments.
This implementation will use the JSONfile configuration because
it has no new dependencies and will provide a similar performance

Notes:
* The facts can purged or read by interacting with the default
  JSON file.
* The caching behavior can be turned off by removing the parameter
  fact_caching from the playbook/ansible.cfg file.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Closes-Bug: 1498111

Change-Id: I95ab1c2f8567d6af68feb53d7c14b8997eef5c89
'}]
commit_message:
Implement fact caching

Fact caching will improve general Ansible performance by default.
This has the biggest performance gain on very large environments.
This implementation will use the JSONfile configuration because
it has no new dependencies and will provide a similar performance
gain as noted through the use of Redis.

Notes:
* The facts can purged or read by interacting with the default
  JSON file.
* The caching behavior can be turned off by removing the parameter
  fact_caching from the playbook/ansible.cfg file.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Implements: blueprint build-facts-archive
Closes-Bug: 1498111

Change-Id: I95ab1c2f8567d6af68feb53d7c14b8997eef5c89

commit_message:
Add rest api method for first page view

This commit adds a new rest endpoint /runs/group_by/metadata_key to
return a json dictionary of the runs stats for all the runs in a given
time resolution grouped by the metadata_key provided in the url.

This will be used for the first page view to return a json dict that
is grouped by project by making a call like: GET /runs/group_by/project
which will return all the runs grouped by project.

Change-Id: I73a9a040a8950b72b399d1866246422b08f2e60d

commit_message:
Fix integration testing

The current setup breaks external connectivity for the test instance.
In order to avoid this, do not set the
external_network_bridge_interface. This will default to the external
network being set up on eth1.

After that, installation is still failing, add removing pre-installed

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-09-25 14:10:49.000000000', 'files': ['barbicanclient/barbican_cli/containers.py', 'functionaltests/cli/v1/behaviors/container_behaviors.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'barbicanclient/barbican_cli/orders.py', 'barbicanclient/osc_plugin.py', 'barbicanclient/barbican_cli/secrets.py', 'barbicanclient/barbican_cli/cas.py', 'setup.cfg', 'barbicanclient/barbican.py'], 'message': 'Create Openstack CLI plugin for Barbican

This is the first implementation of the barbicanclient plugin for the
OpenStack CLI. Since we chose to use cliff in for the client, the
integration with the OCC is quite seamless. Only change that needed to
be done was that, since the OCC uses a ClientManager class to fetch the
specific libraries for the components, we needed to simulate that in the
barbicanclient.

Currently, the plugin can be used if the barbican server is configured
with keystone authentication. This is because currently there is no way
for us to set the X-Project-Id header manually from the client (if the
plugin is being used) but that functionality is out of the scope of this
first implementation.

Change-Id: I37fd158af24e785bc0b7125c6b4c1a9795927a10
'}]
commit_message:
Create Openstack CLI plugin for Barbican

This is the first implementation of the barbicanclient plugin for the
OpenStack CLI. Since we chose to use cliff in for the client, the
integration with the OCC is quite seamless. Only change that needed to
be done was that, since the OCC uses a ClientManager class to fetch the
specific libraries for the components, we needed to simulate that in the
barbicanclient.

Currently, the plugin can be used if the barbican server is configured
with keystone authentication. This is because currently there is no way
for us to set the X-Project-Id header manually from the client (if the
plugin is being used) but that functionality is out of the scope of this
first implementation.

Change-Id: I37fd158af24e785bc0b7125c6b4c1a9795927a10

commit_message:
Improve ERROR_ON_CLONE message

In case ERROR_ON_CLONE is true and triggers a failure for a missing
project, suggest a remedial action.  On their own, people have
come up with remedies that include altering the value of ERROR_ON_CLONE
which rather defeats the purpose.

Change-Id: I28d7f2c184f8440b774fefaa8ec7002d6708db95

commit_message:

get_or_add_user_project_role function was always returning an
empty user_role_id because the role assignment command does not
return any output. Added a command to get the user_role_id after
the assignment happens.

subject: Unicast reactive L3 flows to the correct tunnel port
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 9359, 'name': 'Jianyong Chen', 'email': 'jianyong.jychen@gmail.com', 'username': 'Jianyongchen'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 11343, 'name': 'Gal Sagie', 'email': 'gal.sagie@gmail.com', 'username': 'GalSagie'}, {'_account_id': 13070, 'name': 'Eran Gampel', 'email': 'eran@gampel.net', 'username': 'Gampel'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-07 14:14:56.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/l3_openflow_app.py', 'dragonflow/neutron/agent/l2/ovs_dragonflow_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Unicast reactive L3 flows to the correct tunnel port

In order to avoid flooding and learning for the L3 traffic The
controller marks in the flow the address of the destination VM compute
Node.
We use local vlan mapping to map the tunnel ports destination ip
In the tunnel bridge unicast_to_tunnel table we pre populate match for
the mapped vlan tag and the remote tunnel port.
This solution is needed only for software base tunneling (GRE,VxLAN..)
and not for VLAN base segmentation.
The proposed VLAN mapping is totally isolated from the integration br
VLAN mapping, different pipeline (NORMAL, Openflow).

Closes-Bug: 1480760
(merged form commit 85b0928b84e2338bf5dbb5fba23c03d6f3a72caa)

Change-Id: Ieaf07ad6fdb6f9d24652ea05444a10a7860b386c
'}]
commit_message:
Unicast reactive L3 flows to the correct tunnel port

In order to avoid flooding and learning for the L3 traffic The
controller marks in the flow the address of the destination VM compute
Node.
We use local vlan mapping to map the tunnel ports destination ip
In the tunnel bridge unicast_to_tunnel table we pre populate match for
the mapped vlan tag and the remote tunnel port.
This solution is needed only for software base tunneling (GRE,VxLAN..)
and not for VLAN base segmentation.
The proposed VLAN mapping is totally isolated from the integration br
VLAN mapping, different pipeline (NORMAL, Openflow).

Closes-Bug: 1480760
(merged form commit 85b0928b84e2338bf5dbb5fba23c03d6f3a72caa)

Change-Id: Ieaf07ad6fdb6f9d24652ea05444a10a7860b386c

commit_message:
Make oslo.log work properly with syslog

The syslog support in oslo.log is broken.  This patch makes oslo.log
work properly by using a backported patch from master.

Change-Id: Idb7b38e3cecbfd6547dad148f22f13a4c8557c8f
Implements: bp logging-container

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

This patch fix the issue in the module zaqar/tests/functional/wsgi/v1 and base.py file.
Partial-Bug: #1259292

Change-Id: Ic0c1d46869d34e4eb4604e5ce6a62edd9b2a4824

subject: Fix for Property mapping for Metadef properties fails
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-28 19:15:33.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/metadefs_notification_handler.py'], 'message': 'Fix for Property mapping for Metadef properties fails

Property mapping for Metadef properties regressed to
"name" from "property".

Glance Metadef plugin at some point in previous commits
had a regression on the mapping for property name.
Previous it was "property" and now its changed to "name" which
causes the listener to fail on property updates with
objects and namespaces.

To recreate the bug. Try updating a property on a namespace
and check if the name of the property in the elastic search
document which will not have the updated name.

Change-Id: I1c4e8ec8f1b9648668c9957c88d913bd76834e9e
Closes-Bug: #1492579
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for Property mapping for Metadef properties fails

Property mapping for Metadef properties regressed to
"name" from "property".

Glance Metadef plugin at some point in previous commits
had a regression on the mapping for property name.
Previous it was "property" and now its changed to "name" which
causes the listener to fail on property updates with
objects and namespaces.

To recreate the bug. Try updating a property on a namespace
and check if the name of the property in the elastic search
document which will not have the updated name.

Change-Id: I1c4e8ec8f1b9648668c9957c88d913bd76834e9e
Closes-Bug: #1492579

commit_message:
More efficient result filtering

Instead of passing each result through each plugin, maintain
a backwards lookup of (index, type) -> plugin and only filter
a result through the plugin it belongs to. Changes the signature of
filter_result which only glance/image is currently using.

Change-Id: I617dbddc44dd07303bdd6fe9794fa92484a7eb32
Closes-Bug: #1478102

commit_message:
stackrc set the LC_ALL to C

It will report 'unknown locale: UTF-8', when the env is UTF-8.
Default set the LC_ALL to C in the stackrc, instead. And delete
the duplicate option in stack.sh.

Closes-Bug: 1499296

Change-Id: I14121b25ac314a1a93e6dd6811e196ce2a7c0eb5

The LXC container creation playbook is one of the longest-running playbooks
in the repository.  It generally takes 15-17 minutes to run during the gate
jobs.  Much of this time is spent updating each container with the latest
packages.

This patch causes the LXC cached image to be updated one time before that
image is used for all of the containers.  It reduces the amount of times the
updates actually run and this shortens the time it takes to complete the

commit_message:
Update cached LXC image in place

The LXC container creation playbook is one of the longest-running playbooks
in the repository.  It generally takes 15-17 minutes to run during the gate
jobs.  Much of this time is spent updating each container with the latest
packages.

This patch causes the LXC cached image to be updated one time before that
image is used for all of the containers.  It reduces the amount of times the
updates actually run and this shortens the time it takes to complete the
playbook.

The updates to the cached image will only occur if a new cache image has
just been downloaded.

Partial-bug: 1489169

Change-Id: Iba64f9a3aeb999907088f2a99e8904700074550b
(cherry picked from commit 05ae112e2036cfa862f85b331ffff8657433690c)

commit_message:
Switch to using autogenerated ChangeLog in docs

This commit switches the docs to use the PBR generated ChangeLog
instead of a hand curated release notes section. This is a lot less
error prone and instantaneous as compared to our current method which
often leaves the release notes section stale for months at a time.

Change-Id: Iff6586fc0113fd8292967a536d5bd37cb46ec29d

subject: Use test_to_run var in no-discover
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-28 17:20:27.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/tests/test_os_testr.py', 'os_testr/os_testr.py'], 'message': "Use test_to_run var in no-discover

The use of -n or --pdb was broken if a user
specified the test by path.  The problem is
that even though in the case of -n we parse
out path and convert to import notation, we
weren't using the parsed our variable in the
call_subunit_run call.

Also, it turns out that --pdb and -n are really
both work just fine calling call_subunit_run.  So
we can remove the def call_testtools_run and just
consolidate pdb and -n into a single statement and
runner call.

I looked at using a secondary exclusive group
between no-discover and pdb, but it it shouldn't
matter if a user tries to specify both, the or
statement should evaluate correctly and things
should just work even if it's pointless to type
in `tox -epy27 -- -n --pdb project.tests.test_name`.

Change-Id: Icd61d9fb710807a508c95e8080865429a1f34fb4
Closes-Bug: #1499891
"}]
commit_message:
Use test_to_run var in no-discover

The use of -n or --pdb was broken if a user
specified the test by path.  The problem is
that even though in the case of -n we parse
out path and convert to import notation, we
weren't using the parsed our variable in the
call_subunit_run call.

Also, it turns out that --pdb and -n are really
both work just fine calling call_subunit_run.  So
we can remove the def call_testtools_run and just
consolidate pdb and -n into a single statement and
runner call.

I looked at using a secondary exclusive group
between no-discover and pdb, but it it shouldn't
matter if a user tries to specify both, the or
statement should evaluate correctly and things
should just work even if it's pointless to type
in `tox -epy27 -- -n --pdb project.tests.test_name`.

Change-Id: Icd61d9fb710807a508c95e8080865429a1f34fb4
Closes-Bug: #1499891

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:42:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': 'Rollback is needed if initialize_connection times out

During attach_volume operation, initialize_connection in Cinder
is called. If timeout happens during initialize_connection, the
volume state will be changed back to available.
However, volume could be already mapped to the host on the array.
This leaves the database and array out of sync. If rescan happens
on the host after this, the volume will be visible to the host.
Then if the so-called available volume is deleted, a faulty
device will remain in the host.

This patch handles exception during initialize_connection and
a rollback is triggered by calling terminate_connection in
Cinder.

Change-Id: I9a37e6998bc9520ab0037f9a63e7454980208109
Closes-Bug: #1387807
'}]
commit_message:
Rollback is needed if initialize_connection times out

During attach_volume operation, initialize_connection in Cinder
is called. If timeout happens during initialize_connection, the
volume state will be changed back to available.
However, volume could be already mapped to the host on the array.
This leaves the database and array out of sync. If rescan happens
on the host after this, the volume will be visible to the host.
Then if the so-called available volume is deleted, a faulty
device will remain in the host.

This patch handles exception during initialize_connection and
a rollback is triggered by calling terminate_connection in
Cinder.

Change-Id: I9a37e6998bc9520ab0037f9a63e7454980208109
Closes-Bug: #1387807

subject: Minor refactoring to make os_testr more testable
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-28 16:43:41.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/tests/test_os_testr.py', 'os_testr/os_testr.py'], 'message': "Minor refactoring to make os_testr more testable

While working on some other patches and trying to add
some unit tests there were a few things in os_testr that
made it difficult to test.

Rather than try and be super tricky, just refactor os_testr
a bit.

* Refactor get_parser to handle parse_args for us
  We'll need to explicitly pass in argv here
* Move the logic of selecting/calling the test
  runner into its own helper method (_select_call_runner)
* Modify existing tests to pass args in to get_parser
* Add a new test for runner selection

This cleans up the logic a bit and makes testing a good
deal easier.

Change-Id: I40527601613e6064cf6220f218bef1876ec69cda
"}]
commit_message:
Minor refactoring to make os_testr more testable

While working on some other patches and trying to add
some unit tests there were a few things in os_testr that
made it difficult to test.

Rather than try and be super tricky, just refactor os_testr
a bit.

* Refactor get_parser to handle parse_args for us
  We'll need to explicitly pass in argv here
* Move the logic of selecting/calling the test
  runner into its own helper method (_select_call_runner)
* Modify existing tests to pass args in to get_parser
* Add a new test for runner selection

This cleans up the logic a bit and makes testing a good
deal easier.

Change-Id: I40527601613e6064cf6220f218bef1876ec69cda

subject: Fix a response body in "Compute v2 Show server metadata item details"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-28 06:37:31.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2/api_samples/server-metadata-item-resp.json', 'api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2/api_samples/server-metadata-item-resp.xml', 'api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2/wadl/os-compute-2.wadl'], 'message': 'Fix a response body in "Compute v2 Show server metadata item details"

Fix a response body of "Compute v2 Show server metadata item
details" API.

A response body of "Compute v2 Show server metadata item details"
API should have a "meta" parameter, not a "metadata" parameter.

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.html#getServerMetadataItem

Change-Id: I78b8996604c2780513748f38f5be24cfbfb02c4d
Closes-Bug: #1500314
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a response body in "Compute v2 Show server metadata item details"

Fix a response body of "Compute v2 Show server metadata item
details" API.

A response body of "Compute v2 Show server metadata item details"
API should have a "meta" parameter, not a "metadata" parameter.

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.html#getServerMetadataItem

Change-Id: I78b8996604c2780513748f38f5be24cfbfb02c4d

commit_message:
Prevent ilo drivers powering off active nodes during take over

Currently, ilo drivers powers off active nodes
when a conductor takes over the node from another conductor.
This commit stops this, as active nodes shouldn't be powered
off during take over.

Closes-bug: 1490019
Change-Id: I8e54ae148ed9cfdcb6639a4d089ee82f14de53ba
(cherry picked from commit e6c2a787d4a63e52f57079e0a747522f0467b0f2)

revisions:
[{'number': 24, 'created': '2014-12-18 08:03:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/base.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'etc/neutron.conf', 'neutron/tests/functional/sanity/test_sanity.py', 'neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py', 'neutron/agent/common/config.py'], 'message': "Option for root_helper when checking namespace

Adds a configuration option to use the root helper in the ip netns list
command executed by the IP library when checking for the existence of a
namespace.  This prevents an unprivileged l3 agent from erroneously trying
to create another namespace when one already exists. This is necessary in
environments with constrained permissions on /var/run/netns via umask or
other access controls.

However, due to the overhead incurred by calling sudo every time on systems
where this restriction isn't in place, this configuration won't be desired
all of the time. So this patch also adds a sanity check that reports back
whether or not the root_helper is required for a deployment.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1348812
Closes-Bug: #1311804
Change-Id: If7560161de3be6066af0d9866e6b5cd7c7247c33
"}]
commit_message:
Option for root_helper when checking namespace

Adds a configuration option to use the root helper in the ip netns list
command executed by the IP library when checking for the existence of a
namespace.  This prevents an unprivileged l3 agent from erroneously trying
to create another namespace when one already exists. This is necessary in
environments with constrained permissions on /var/run/netns via umask or
other access controls.

However, due to the overhead incurred by calling sudo every time on systems
where this restriction isn't in place, this configuration won't be desired
all of the time. So this patch also adds a sanity check that reports back
whether or not the root_helper is required for a deployment.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1348812
Closes-Bug: #1311804
Change-Id: If7560161de3be6066af0d9866e6b5cd7c7247c33

commit_message:
Adjust rally jobs to use ceilometer devstack plugin

Ceilometer is moving to being a devstack plugin. This change ensures
that enable_plugin is called where required. It also makes sure that
DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG does not clobbered by subsequent calls.

Change-Id: I48f3b53ab25046b4309ee684da1683cf431a4398
Related-Bug: #1489436

commit_message:
Fixing traces of "Replace prt variable by port"

The fix for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218350/ has few
more occurrences. This patch addresses those and also changes
"local_port" from "port" in order not to confuse the parameter
with method argument.

Change-Id: I60bfeb9e33f0f69153afec083a2c05ee862fcee2

commit_message:
Add required styles and fonts.

Add static instances of FontAwesome, Bootstrap, and theme resources
to more fully move to NPM/Browserify package management.

Change-Id: I4ceb0cd44f1e54207fde9c6645931e3a29705894

commit_message:
SubnetPoolsTest: Skip IPv6 tests appropriately

Rename a class variable so that it will be checked by the base class.

Certain tests were not being run correctly due to subclasses
incorrectly overriding a base class variable. This change names
the variable correctly in the subclasses to fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1497188
Change-Id: I97756b91cbec297ade7efcc8986a038a184b3a84

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-24 10:19:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/utils.py', 'neutron/agent/common/utils.py'], 'message': "Fixes 'ovs-agent cannot start on Windows because root_helper opt is not found'

Change Ie1224f8a1c17268cd7d1c474ed82fdfb8852eaa8 removed
config.register_root_helper() from ovs_neutron_agent:main, thus the agent
cannot start on Windows since root_helper config option is never
registered.

The fix consists in adding config.register_root_helper in the Windows side
utils.

Closes-Bug: #1497930

Change-Id: I6adc3b869c9564cac3ab99174b8fe47584213e59
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes 'ovs-agent cannot start on Windows because root_helper opt is not found'

Change Ie1224f8a1c17268cd7d1c474ed82fdfb8852eaa8 removed
config.register_root_helper() from ovs_neutron_agent:main, thus the agent
cannot start on Windows since root_helper config option is never
registered.

The fix consists in adding config.register_root_helper in the Windows side
utils.

Closes-Bug: #1497930

Change-Id: I6adc3b869c9564cac3ab99174b8fe47584213e59

commit_message:
Add --force when doing initial index sync

When installing devstack, it freezes and needs to have manual
intervention to continue. searhclight-manage index sync needs
to have --force so that it will complete the index operation.

Change-Id: I16f951e4dbe1d753b6a5e03abcae6b391ac9d5ee
Closes-Bug: #1500318

commit_message:
Use 'cobbler'  as default provisioning method

If no 'provision' section found in cluster metadata, assume default
provisioning method to be 'cobbler' (as per 5.1.1 series).

Change-Id: I18a1c2e222f2ac957c70946a3956dda142608156

commit_message:
Added minimum disk requirements for MongoDB

Added a minimum of 10240 MB disk space as a requirement for a
MongoDB partitition.

Broke the section on more modular chunks. Rewrote the text according
to the OpenStack Style standards.

Closes-bug: #1380565
Change-Id: I8bc051b8578c81772eeae91d0c47905eb6b9bb08

commit_message:
Use ceilometer devstack plugin in gate

Turn on the ceilometer devstack plugin in the various ceilometer
related job descriptions. The relies on enable_plugin failing
gracefully when it does not exist (on an older branch).

Depends-On: I413ab159474b7d7231ad66d3a482201f74efe8a8
Change-Id: I63e7cfc2425b4f33b91ef56f22bc30e3f02ca66a

subject: Ignore empty log translation source files
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-28 17:33:06.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Ignore empty log translation source files

We do not need to store any empty source translation files in git or in
Zanata. There are many empty LOG source translation files, so let's
remove them.

Note we always keep the "main" files, the "main" files should always
have content.

The change tests after generation of LOG source translation files
whether these are empty and deletes them from filesystem and git.

Change-Id: I0957c66fca5aa5ded93c858766a4c0a93f963032
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore empty log translation source files

We do not need to store any empty source translation files in git or in
Zanata. There are many empty LOG source translation files, so let's
remove them.

Note we always keep the "main" files, the "main" files should always
have content.

The change tests after generation of LOG source translation files
whether these are empty and deletes them from filesystem and git.

Change-Id: I0957c66fca5aa5ded93c858766a4c0a93f963032

Add _save_screenshot functionality to helpers.

Having screenshot of failed test might increase speed of
understanding the failure reason.

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer in favor of plugin

The ceilometer project is moving to using a devstack plugin rather
than having ceilometer in the base devstack. This is to allow
greater control and flexibility.

Change-Id: I413ab159474b7d7231ad66d3a482201f74efe8a8

commit_message:
Enable space-before-function-paren

This rule disallows the use of extraneous whitespace before
functions. It follows the PEP-8 'extraneous whitespace' standard.

https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#pet-peeves
http://eslint.org/docs/rules/space-before-function-paren

Change-Id: I1f07e88ac5dd0ea7c4fc6d56256628d6967d1bbf

commit_message:
Add new Murano scenarios

- added four new Murano scenarios which check performance of
commands which work with packages, like 'import-package', 'list-packages',
'delete-package'.
- added appropriate methods into the murano/utils.py
- added unit tests

Change-Id: I655bb0c8a0980c59cd4ab576f97ee94c2c3cd0f7

commit_message:
Implement Tacker MANO API client changes

python-tackerclient has been modified to invoke Tacker MANO API
directly for VNF and VNFD resource requests. The current wrapper
implementation of invoking servicevm REST APIs has been removed.

Change-Id: I447fd971d97987911d5e85abafc94a24599ac209
Implements: blueprint tacker-api-mano
Depends-On: I9dffd4bee25b1f49aea7478f2bd779cf0f6dfb49

commit_message:
Implementation of Tacker NFV MANO API

Introduce new Tacker REST API endpoints 'vnfd' and 'vnf' based on NFV
MANO in 'vnfm' extension. Existing 'device' and'device_template'
endpoints will be retained for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I9dffd4bee25b1f49aea7478f2bd779cf0f6dfb49
Implements: blueprint tacker-api-mano

commit_message:
Add heal_instance_info_cache_interval to nova.conf

This attribute is not currently a part of the cookbook template.
Adding this attribute will allow operators to configure this option
which can reduce unecessary neutron requests in non OVS or Linux
Bridge deployments.

Closes-Bug:1499551

Change-Id: Ibcf6b7bb614d629926b7d1f50ac552a9d1b1e670

commit_message:
Fixing cluster and node group template updates

Changes:

* volume(s)_* fields now can be updated without
  updating volumes_per_node field
* ngt now can be updated without node_processes field
* arguments of update methods (except of id) changed
  to optional

Change-Id: I3549cb98f1c15d303cdc13bbd3875a85b43f29b8
Closes-bug: #1499730
Closes-bug: #1499732

subject: Use test_to_run var in no-discover
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-26 14:40:47.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/tests/test_os_testr.py', 'os_testr/os_testr.py'], 'message': "Use test_to_run var in no-discover

The --no-discover option is cool, and it turns out
it has everything needed to work on tests specified
by path.

The only thing missing was that the actual call for
subunit_run was using the opts.no_discover arg and
not the parsed out test_to_run var that somebody
was nice enough to go through the trouble to implement.

This patch just uses that var and now if somebody wants
they can specify test by path.

Also, there's no need for a separate call_testtools_run
method any longer.  The subunit_run call handles
breakpoints just fine so condense both no-discover and
pdb  calls to just use subunit_run and we can remove
call_testtools_run altogether.

Change-Id: I684dda7c5baf5909690baac72ce1084e8aace879
Closes-Bug: #1499891
"}]
commit_message:
Use test_to_run var in no-discover

The --no-discover option is cool, and it turns out
it has everything needed to work on tests specified
by path.

The only thing missing was that the actual call for
subunit_run was using the opts.no_discover arg and
not the parsed out test_to_run var that somebody
was nice enough to go through the trouble to implement.

This patch just uses that var and now if somebody wants
they can specify test by path.

Also, there's no need for a separate call_testtools_run
method any longer.  The subunit_run call handles
breakpoints just fine so condense both no-discover and
pdb  calls to just use subunit_run and we can remove
call_testtools_run altogether.

Change-Id: I684dda7c5baf5909690baac72ce1084e8aace879
Closes-Bug: #1499891

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-08-28 19:53:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Add wait for vif unplug events on destroy

We add a force wait for vif unplug events from neutron because some
operations like rebuilding require the VM to be completely unplugged or
neutron will never send a vifplugged notification since the port status
does not change.

The default is for this event to not be fatal and simply log a warning
but can be configured to re-raise the exception. Regardless the instance
is cleaned up and destroyed.

Closes-Bug: #1482392
Change-Id: Ibb1c69fe3f44feb6d439cd3b6ff68331dc2757a1
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add wait for vif unplug events on destroy

We add a force wait for vif unplug events from neutron because some
operations like rebuilding require the VM to be completely unplugged or
neutron will never send a vifplugged notification since the port status
does not change.

The default is for this event to not be fatal and simply log a warning
but can be configured to re-raise the exception. Regardless the instance
is cleaned up and destroyed.

Closes-Bug: #1482392
Change-Id: Ibb1c69fe3f44feb6d439cd3b6ff68331dc2757a1

revisions:

Having a local copy of a library is a bad practice. Files are
duplicated on the system, it's harder to update it.

For example, the local copy of dateutil 1.5 is not compatible with
Python 3.

Replace the local copy with a dependency to dateutil, at least the
version 2.4.2. dateutil 2.4.2 is compatible with Python 3.

Change-Id: I366c8004e5eb683b41fec2c31cf4a5afdb48180c
"}]
commit_message:
Replace local copy of dateutil 1.5, use dependency

Having a local copy of a library is a bad practice. Files are
duplicated on the system, it's harder to update it.

For example, the local copy of dateutil 1.5 is not compatible with
Python 3.

Replace the local copy with a dependency to dateutil, at least the
version 2.4.2. dateutil 2.4.2 is compatible with Python 3.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: I366c8004e5eb683b41fec2c31cf4a5afdb48180c

commit_message:
Append information during automatic image uploading

Right after package/bundle upload, user deploy it. But
deployment get fail since image is not ready yet. So append
information to the success message that image will be ready for
deployment after some time.

At the moment, all the iSCSI initiator utils classes can be found
in the volumeutils modules. This is quite misleading, especially
as we are going to add iSCSI target server utils classes and
other initiator types.

This patch moves and renames the current volumeutils modules to:

storage
    initiator
        base_iscsi_utils.py
        iscsi_cli_utils.py
        iscsi_wmi_utils.py

The utilsfactory get_volumeutils method is left for backwards
compatibility with Nova.

Change-Id: I1bc6628dc842595de3fb6daa4f39ca330609cfa2

commit_message:
Refactor iscsi initiator utils

At the moment, all the iSCSI initiator utils classes can be found
in the volumeutils modules. This is quite misleading, especially
as we are going to add iSCSI target server utils classes and
other initiator types.

This patch moves and renames the current volumeutils modules to:

storage
    initiator
        base_iscsi_utils.py
        iscsi_cli_utils.py
        iscsi_wmi_utils.py

The utilsfactory get_volumeutils method is left for backwards
compatibility with Nova.

Change-Id: I1bc6628dc842595de3fb6daa4f39ca330609cfa2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-23 00:40:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/client_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Make re-raising of client exceptions safer

Given that we are passing the exception value as a parameter to
ignore_not_found() and its ilk, it is very unexpected that they ignore this
parameter and instead raise whatever the last exception was. Guard against
this by checking that we really are re-raising the same exception, and fall
back to re-raising the correct exception with a new stack trace if not.

Change-Id: I18a86569a9ba4ee81d943d496349a585dad74ef6
Related-Bug: #1495714
'}]
commit_message:
Make re-raising of client exceptions safer

Given that we are passing the exception value as a parameter to
ignore_not_found() and its ilk, it is very unexpected that they ignore this
parameter and instead raise whatever the last exception was. Guard against
this by checking that we really are re-raising the same exception, and fall
back to re-raising the correct exception with a new stack trace if not.

Change-Id: I18a86569a9ba4ee81d943d496349a585dad74ef6
Related-Bug: #1495714

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:06:30.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I84c23863e73684f0c22a90e447af69dec4789523
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I84c23863e73684f0c22a90e447af69dec4789523
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-14 03:08:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/user.py', 'openstack_auth/models.py'], 'message': 'Replace default User model PK

The default Django User model PK is an int() AutoField
and django-openstack-auth sets this to a hash string. Django
then breaks trying to coerce that string to an int().

This patch adds a new explicit PK to the d-o-a User
model. It also adds the standard Django "models.py" so
that the consumer application (Horizon) may use it.

The consumer application must set:

   AUTH_USER_MODEL = 'openstack_auth.User'

to use the new model in place of the default 'auth.User'.

The approach in this patch was inspired by Lin Hua
Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>.

Partial-Bug: 1491117
Change-Id: I549209eb0bb0ddf36d92ee9dc1a9bac799ce67e5
'}]
commit_message:
Replace default User model PK

The default Django User model PK is an int() AutoField
and django-openstack-auth sets this to a hash string. Django
then breaks trying to coerce that string to an int().

This patch adds a new explicit PK to the d-o-a User
model. It also adds the standard Django "models.py" so
that the consumer application (Horizon) may use it.

The consumer application must set:

   AUTH_USER_MODEL = 'openstack_auth.User'

to use the new model in place of the default 'auth.User'.

The approach in this patch was inspired by Lin Hua
Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>.

Partial-Bug: 1491117
Change-Id: I549209eb0bb0ddf36d92ee9dc1a9bac799ce67e5

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-28 09:55:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py'], 'message': 'Adjust the relationship of Instance and PciDeviceList

This is basically a revert of commit 80c109f85a9e8b182e918027731760e91026cb81

The commit 1d4ad44f15503b8710ff59dea9f5e3f4894d56fb missed to bump
the PciDeviceList version also the relationship with Instance
object.

The later commit 80c109f85a9e8b182e918027731760e91026cb81 fixed
that. That commit make the CD user can upgrade to that commit
successful. And after that commit 363ef82a66cb3b3528de03686f79f7c13ef33305
revert the relationship between Instance and PciDeviceList to the
right one. But that leads to the kilo stable user (or running the
code before commit 363ef82a66cb3b3528de03686f79f7c13ef33305)
can't upgrade the code to Liberty.

So when the system run Liberty controller and Kilo stable compute
node(or before commit 363ef82a66cb3b3528de03686f79f7c13ef33305),
the booing instance is broken. The reason is Kilo compute node only
know PciDeviceList 1.1, but the Liberty conductor will return
PciDeviceList 1.2 based on the relationship.

This patch adjusts Instance and PciDeviceList relationship to
"1.20: 1.2". Due to Kilo stable only support 1.19, that makes
Liberty conductor only backport 1.1 for Instance < 1.20.

Related-bug: #1500289
Change-Id: Ie6dce1de178bfa8cb9f93c009cdfed512393c5b5
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust the relationship of Instance and PciDeviceList

This is basically a revert of commit 80c109f85a9e8b182e918027731760e91026cb81

The commit 1d4ad44f15503b8710ff59dea9f5e3f4894d56fb missed to bump
the PciDeviceList version also the relationship with Instance
object.

The later commit 80c109f85a9e8b182e918027731760e91026cb81 fixed
that. That commit make the CD user can upgrade to that commit
successful. And after that commit 363ef82a66cb3b3528de03686f79f7c13ef33305
revert the relationship between Instance and PciDeviceList to the
right one. But that leads to the kilo stable user (or running the
code before commit 363ef82a66cb3b3528de03686f79f7c13ef33305)
can't upgrade the code to Liberty.

So when the system run Liberty controller and Kilo stable compute
node(or before commit 363ef82a66cb3b3528de03686f79f7c13ef33305),
the booing instance is broken. The reason is Kilo compute node only
know PciDeviceList 1.1, but the Liberty conductor will return
PciDeviceList 1.2 based on the relationship.

This patch adjusts Instance and PciDeviceList relationship to
"1.20: 1.2". Due to Kilo stable only support 1.19, that makes
Liberty conductor only backport 1.1 for Instance < 1.20.

Related-bug: #1500289
Change-Id: Ie6dce1de178bfa8cb9f93c009cdfed512393c5b5

commit_message:
Cleanup of Translations

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle some of these cases.

Change-Id: I4a2ed83862c7b32a0a93bfb1f040dfbe9e1d03af

commit_message:
Fix string formatting issues

if keyworded substitution is used, the formatter must be a dict
(even for single element).

Add a missing unit test for a code branch where a formatting
error was found.

Also, fix a tiny error message typo (missing space).

Change-Id: Ib1649511b2613bc1a8ba52398543be0fdfefb8db
Closes-Bug: #1494574

subject: Improve SLO PUT error checking
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 16206, 'name': 'chenhuayi', 'email': 'chenhuayi@huawei.com', 'username': 'chenhuayi2'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 01:35:21.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py'], 'message': 'Improve SLO PUT error checking

Previously, if you uploaded a segment reference with '{"size_bytes":
null, ...}' in it and the referenced segment was less than 1 MiB,
you'd get a response that looked like this:

    HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
    Content-Length: 62
    Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
    X-Trans-Id: txd9ee3b25896642098e4d9-0055dd095a
    Date: Wed, 26 Aug 2015 00:33:30 GMT

    Each segment, except the last, must be at least 1048576 bytes.

This is true, but not particularly helpful, since it doesn't tell you
which of your segments violated the rule.

Now you get something more like this:

    HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
    Content-Length: 49
    Content-Type: text/plain
    X-Trans-Id: tx586e52580bac4956ad8e2-0055dd09c2
    Date: Wed, 26 Aug 2015 00:35:14 GMT

    Errors:
    /segs/small, Too Small (minimum 1048576B)

It's not exactly a tutorial on SLO manifests, but at least it names
the problematic segment.

I also split the error checking into two steps: first, SLO does all
the checks it can without making any subrequests. If there are errors
in that first pass, like a size_bytes that's *specified* as too small
or a self-referential manifest, then SLO returns those errors. This
way we don't waste time doing a bunch of HEAD requests for something
we already know is bogus. Second pass is all the
HEAD-request-and-check-matching stuff that SLO already does.

Change-Id: I5619b045e4e741f98c2fa7564a4de30e510f39eb
'}]
commit_message:
Improve SLO PUT error checking

Previously, if you uploaded a segment reference with '{"size_bytes":
null, ...}' in it and the referenced segment was less than 1 MiB,
you'd get a response that looked like this:

    HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
    Content-Length: 62
    Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
    X-Trans-Id: txd9ee3b25896642098e4d9-0055dd095a
    Date: Wed, 26 Aug 2015 00:33:30 GMT

    Each segment, except the last, must be at least 1048576 bytes.

This is true, but not particularly helpful, since it doesn't tell you
which of your segments violated the rule.

Now you get something more like this:

    HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
    Content-Length: 49
    Content-Type: text/plain
    X-Trans-Id: tx586e52580bac4956ad8e2-0055dd09c2
    Date: Wed, 26 Aug 2015 00:35:14 GMT

    Errors:
    /segs/small, Too Small (minimum 1048576B)

It's not exactly a tutorial on SLO manifests, but at least it names
the problematic segment.

I also split the error checking into two steps: first, SLO does all
the checks it can without making any subrequests. If there are errors
in that first pass, like a size_bytes that's *specified* as too small
or a self-referential manifest, then SLO returns those errors. This
way we don't waste time doing a bunch of HEAD requests for something
we already know is bogus. Second pass is all the
HEAD-request-and-check-matching stuff that SLO already does.

Change-Id: I5619b045e4e741f98c2fa7564a4de30e510f39eb

commit_message:
Fix tab/space indentation

This change is required to support Python 3. On Python 3, it's no
more possible to use tabs and spaces to indent a block of code.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: Id511ef23cb2dc2898c7aacfcc574f2801a308b4d

subject: remove POSIX users, groups and file modes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-28 14:40:49.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/proxy/authtoken.pp', 'manifests/proxy.pp', 'manifests/dispersion.pp', 'spec/classes/swift_proxy_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/swift_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/swift_proxy_authtoken_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/swift_dispersion_spec.rb'], 'message': "remove POSIX users, groups and file modes

Stop managing POSIX users, groups and file modes for:
* dispersion.pp
* init.pp
* proxy.pp
* proxy/authtoken.pp

For init.pp: introduce manage_user boolean (True by default for backward
compatibility) because proxy/ceilometer.pp needs the resource managed by
Puppet.

Because packaging does not handle it yet, continue to handle it for:
* proxy/ceilometer.pp
* storage/server.pp
We can't drop the POSIX resources here, it will break deployments on RDO
& UCA.

Partial-bug #1458915

Change-Id: I03e04bd9fe2d6b7e19798da022ece06bcfb87032
"}]
commit_message:
remove POSIX users, groups and file modes

Stop managing POSIX users, groups and file modes for:
* dispersion.pp
* init.pp
* proxy.pp
* proxy/authtoken.pp

For init.pp: introduce manage_user boolean (True by default for backward
compatibility) because proxy/ceilometer.pp needs the resource managed by
Puppet.

Because packaging does not handle it yet, continue to handle it for:
* proxy/ceilometer.pp
* storage/server.pp
We can't drop the POSIX resources here, it will break deployments on RDO
& UCA.

Partial-bug #1458915

Change-Id: I03e04bd9fe2d6b7e19798da022ece06bcfb87032

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3099, 'name': 'David Shrewsbury', 'email': 'dshrewsb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dshrews'}, {'_account_id': 5545, 'name': 'matthew wagoner', 'email': 'zxkuqyb@gmail.com', 'username': 'zxkuqyb'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-27 16:10:21.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade_operator.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fix baremetal port deletion

Shade's node deletion logic removes ports one at a time in
the requested order, however that logic has been silently failing
to the API for some time now as we're inadvertently returning the
entire port object back to the API as the port we wish to delete
instead of the port UUID.

Changed to return the port UUID value to the delete call.
Added code to unit test to ensure that correct action is taken.

Closes-Bug: #1500063
Change-Id: I01c16990dc66988fab29c41ec4b4e6094213b2ca
"}]
commit_message:
Fix baremetal port deletion

Shade's node deletion logic removes ports one at a time in
the requested order, however that logic has been silently failing
to the API for some time now as we're inadvertently returning the
entire port object back to the API as the port we wish to delete
instead of the port UUID.

Changed to return the port UUID value to the delete call.
Added code to unit test to ensure that correct action is taken.

Closes-Bug: #1500063
Change-Id: I01c16990dc66988fab29c41ec4b4e6094213b2ca

commit_message:
devstack: only tail Apache error and access log

This will solve the following issue:

---snip---
sudo tail -f /var/log/apache2/access[._]log
tail: cannot open '/var/log/apache2/access[._]log' for reading: No such
file or directory
---snap---

Change-Id: I677b149a0a6fd41ad62df6061638b97cd9a0a1c0

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-25 19:43:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/filter_scheduler.rst', 'nova/scheduler/filters/trusted_filter.py'], 'message': 'Set TrustedFilter as experimental

The TrustedFilter is the only in-tree scheduler filter that calls an external
3rd-party service (OpenAttestation) for decision-making. Thus, the OAT service
is not listed as an official Nova dependency and consequently not even gated,
even by a 3rd-party CI.

Besides, some discussions have been captured in a ML thread that show that
running this filter is not the best way for enforcing trusted compute nodes [1]
but I leave that out of the review (just a FYI) because the main reason for
making experimental the filter is to send a signal to operators that they will
either have to find another solution or accept the current gaps.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067766.html

Related-Bug: #1456228

Change-Id: I6ab013faf22a0e88424207830ec399724f827622
'}]
commit_message:
Set TrustedFilter as experimental

The TrustedFilter is the only in-tree scheduler filter that calls an external
3rd-party service (OpenAttestation) for decision-making. Thus, the OAT service
is not listed as an official Nova dependency and consequently not even gated,
even by a 3rd-party CI.

Besides, some discussions have been captured in a ML thread that show that
running this filter is not the best way for enforcing trusted compute nodes [1]
but I leave that out of the review (just a FYI) because the main reason for
making experimental the filter is to send a signal to operators that they will
either have to find another solution or accept the current gaps.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/067766.html

Related-Bug: #1456228

Change-Id: I6ab013faf22a0e88424207830ec399724f827622

post morted etc.).

commit_message:
Also log the share id when logging share instance creation

It's useful to also log the share id when we log the creation of the
share. Especially when multiple shares are created at the same time.

The share id is already logged when we log the deletion of the share.

Change-Id: Iec04c28142fe2d7457f1f11c9de3e1509b82c2c2

commit_message:
Adding svn for file download.

Murano agent can download files in the VM when it is executing the
 execution plan. However, just git client is allowed for download
 files. Svn client should be provided to add files in a svn repository

Closes Bug: #1486055
Change-Id: Ib1fd13fa86d012fb95d19aabda0dff7c28f99620

commit_message:
Added MAINTAINERS to fuelmenu

In a consensus reached in a proposal for code review process
change [1], and proposed team structure policy document [2],
adding MAINTAINERS files in repositories.
This commit adds a maintainer to fuelmenu in fuel-web repo.

Please note, that files are written in YAML format in order
to allow further automation around code review process.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/072406.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-September/074984.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225376/1

Change-Id: If82536d7192062cbd2871391b7b02e40187b8bb5

commit_message:
Update UI definitions to 2.2 version

Now latest supported version is 2.2.
It was in blueprint.
In this commits version of all apps is updated.
New definitions will be not supported by old
murano releases, since apps from corresponding
branch need to be used.

Change-Id: I0a001c44ab32b11387bd1c3930aca89391501d8a
Closes-Bug: #1495548
(cherry picked from commit c7896d90c9d7101a9d7c977beac4c452e6ed9cfe)

commit_message:
Allow running postconfig outside deploy command

Currently, if there's a failure in postconfig for any reason, the only
way to continue is to either perform the steps manually or entirely
redeploy.

This patch adds the "openstack overcloud postconfig" command, intending
to make it available to resolve that case.

Depends-On: I98e19cc29d69cbd6636cd4ce77a07c7a0e3dc048
Depends-On: I205569f4be0bcee2b284048dec7ddf0b28bbd8a1
Depends-On: I4a819c4262bde4d38e3f51150413836ca83646a0
Change-Id: I387d9993fae00b2f4537c3d3ec7d491bb2f7c0cd

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This updates also recreates pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository in case there was no recent

not handle some of these cases.

Change-Id: I6fae832e10ba86f6dff15a07b46eb9810ad25061
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup of Translations

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This updates also recreates pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository in case there was no recent
import for them.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle some of these cases.

Change-Id: I6fae832e10ba86f6dff15a07b46eb9810ad25061

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-17 21:37:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_async_process.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_ovsdb_monitor.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/async_process.py'], 'message': 'Introduce kill_signal parameter to AsynProcess.stop()

All stop() calls of instances of AsyncProcess class were sending
hardcoded SIGKILL signal to its process. This patch leaves the default
behavior to SIGKILL but offers any number to be sent to kill command.

Note: Internal private methods also got a new parameter which is not
      appended. Given that those methods are private and thus not used
      outside of the class, we can afford it.

Change-Id: Ib7b0273c134d59c6a50173d4c2eb35761fcd3d62
Related-Bug: #1487548
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce kill_signal parameter to AsynProcess.stop()

All stop() calls of instances of AsyncProcess class were sending
hardcoded SIGKILL signal to its process. This patch leaves the default
behavior to SIGKILL but offers any number to be sent to kill command.

Note: Internal private methods also got a new parameter which is not
      appended. Given that those methods are private and thus not used
      outside of the class, we can afford it.

Change-Id: Ib7b0273c134d59c6a50173d4c2eb35761fcd3d62
Related-Bug: #1487548

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-08-06 19:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix live-migrations usage of the wrong connector information

During the post_live_migration step for the Nova libvirt driver
an incorrect assumption is being made about the connector
information being sent to _disconnect_volume. It is assumed that
the connection information on the source and destination is the
same but that is not always the case. The BDM, where the
connector information is being retrieved from only contains the
connection information for the destination. This will not work
when trying to disconnect volumes from the source during live
migration as the properties such as the target_lun and
initiator_target_map could be different. This ends up leaving
behind dangling LUNs and possibly removing the incorrect
volume's LUNs.

The solution proposed here utilizes the connection_info that
can be retrieved for a host from Cinder's initialize_connection
API. This connection information contains the correct data for
the source host and allows volume LUNs to be removed properly.

Change-Id: I3dfb75eb58dfbc66b218bcee473af4c2ac282eb6
Closes-Bug: #1475411
Closes-Bug: #1288039
Closes-Bug: #1423772
"}]
commit_message:
Fix live-migrations usage of the wrong connector information

During the post_live_migration step for the Nova libvirt driver
an incorrect assumption is being made about the connector
information being sent to _disconnect_volume. It is assumed that
the connection information on the source and destination is the
same but that is not always the case. The BDM, where the
connector information is being retrieved from only contains the
connection information for the destination. This will not work
when trying to disconnect volumes from the source during live
migration as the properties such as the target_lun and
initiator_target_map could be different. This ends up leaving
behind dangling LUNs and possibly removing the incorrect
volume's LUNs.

The solution proposed here utilizes the connection_info that
can be retrieved for a host from Cinder's initialize_connection
API. This connection information contains the correct data for
the source host and allows volume LUNs to be removed properly.

Change-Id: I3dfb75eb58dfbc66b218bcee473af4c2ac282eb6
Closes-Bug: #1475411
Closes-Bug: #1288039
Closes-Bug: #1423772

commit_message:
Adding update and minor fixes to Data Sources CLI

Changes:
* adding Data Sources update command to OpenstackClient CLI:
  $ dataprocessing data sources update
* adding ability to delete multiple data sources with one call
* adding prepare_column_headers method to osc utils
* adding public and protected support to datasources
* changing utils.get_resource method

Partially implements: blueprint cli-as-openstackclient-plugin

Change-Id: If3b1811eea5d1d9770c286dc9487d278f3616c48

subject: tox: fix too much test running in specific envs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-24 19:15:51.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini', 'run-tests.sh'], 'message': 'tox: fix too much test running in specific envs

When running a specific env such as e.g. py27-postgresql-file, the lines
in the global commands variable starting with "py27:" also matches,
which means we ended up running the global test suite too!

This refactor the code a bit so we always call run-tests.sh with just
some environment variable set using `setenv'.

Change-Id: Icb2879f383c1d0a09a1cd1fce1cbadfa1207c6c9
'}]
commit_message:
tox: fix too much test running in specific envs

When running a specific env such as e.g. py27-postgresql-file, the lines
in the global commands variable starting with "py27:" also matches,
which means we ended up running the global test suite too!

This refactor the code a bit so we always call run-tests.sh with just
some environment variable set using `setenv'.

Change-Id: Icb2879f383c1d0a09a1cd1fce1cbadfa1207c6c9
