'}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster node membership refresh

This patch partially fixes bugs related to cluster node membership. Each
time we create or delete nodes in batch, we need to refresh the cached
node membership in the runtime data of the cluster in question.

Change-Id: I21f38bf4cb38f2f714c6f91d20e1efb7f1f5e764

subject: Use the test_to_run var in no-discover
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-25 21:34:48.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/os_testr.py'], 'message': 'Use the test_to_run var in no-discover

The --no-discover option is cool, and it turns out
it has everything needed to work on tests specified
by path.

The only thing missing was that the actual call for
subunit_run was using the opts.no_discover arg and
not the parsed out test_to_run var that somebody
was nice enough to go through the trouble to implement.

This patch just uses that var and now if somebody wants
they can specify test by path.

Change-Id: Idb9ca9c5a23e47a4ff050c4d73ea9072964b469c
Closes-Bug: #1499891
'}]
commit_message:
Use the test_to_run var in no-discover

The --no-discover option is cool, and it turns out
it has everything needed to work on tests specified
by path.

The only thing missing was that the actual call for
subunit_run was using the opts.no_discover arg and
not the parsed out test_to_run var that somebody
was nice enough to go through the trouble to implement.

This patch just uses that var and now if somebody wants
they can specify test by path.

Change-Id: Idb9ca9c5a23e47a4ff050c4d73ea9072964b469c
Closes-Bug: #1499891

subject: Remove unneeded call_testtools_run method
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-25 21:33:13.000000000', 'files': ['os_testr/os_testr.py'], 'message': 'Remove unneeded call_testtools_run method

It turns out that call_subunit_run handles breakpoints just
fine.  I discovered this by accident by using no-discover
option on tests that had breakpoints in them:
    tox -epy27 -- -n cinder.tests.test_volume

Since this works just fine, we can use the same mechanism
to run pdb specified tests:
    tox -epy27 -- -pdb cinder.tests.test_volume

That also means we no longer use the call_testtools_run
method anywhere, so we can remove it.

Change-Id: Iab8b9f56609d4d5a8087dbf7cee0e67dd1c834a6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unneeded call_testtools_run method

It turns out that call_subunit_run handles breakpoints just
fine.  I discovered this by accident by using no-discover
option on tests that had breakpoints in them:
    tox -epy27 -- -n cinder.tests.test_volume

Since this works just fine, we can use the same mechanism
to run pdb specified tests:
    tox -epy27 -- -pdb cinder.tests.test_volume

That also means we no longer use the call_testtools_run
method anywhere, so we can remove it.

Change-Id: Iab8b9f56609d4d5a8087dbf7cee0e67dd1c834a6

commit_message:
Translations: Ignore Generated-By changes

Today's import includes some files where only the Generated-By line
changes since Babel updated from 2.0 to 2.1.1. Add line to blacklist so
that a review is not generated for files with just this single line
changed.

Change-Id: I8bd477882ca621ece95faa90b4edf2da39925785

commit_message:
Revert netapp_lib dependency in NetApp cDOT Manila drivers

The community asked us to remove the dependency on a PyPI
library with a proprietary license.  This commit does that
while preserving some minor refactoring that was done at the
same time.

Reverts commit ca6168d01bea405718bbf6a36d4bb75c23d1b783.

Closes-Bug: #1499334
Change-Id: I1a4b1b2b2151bb222ae5c77b9b317e7505255067

Change-Id: Ib31522f1a3024981bfbcd93f0df09f8ad0be963d

commit_message:
Quick return from create nodes if count 0

When count is 0, e.g. cluster.desired_capacity is set to 0, we don't
bother to execute any node creation logic. This patch provides a quick
path for return.

Change-Id: Ib31522f1a3024981bfbcd93f0df09f8ad0be963d

subject: Further improve the healthcheck output
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-17 22:07:40.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/healthcheck/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Further improve the healthcheck output

Add on information about the active threads and active
greenthreads and some basic server information to be able
to show this to operators (or others) that have detailed
mode enabled and can benefit from this information being
output.

This addition makes it so that basic diagnostic information
can be obtained from the response of the healthcheck middleware
and not just OK or NOT OK; making the eventlet backdoor feature
that oslo.service provides less needed for operators.

Change-Id: I469c56586597561633921ebf3916585646f45373
'}]
commit_message:
Further improve the healthcheck output

Add on information about the active threads and active
greenthreads and some basic server information to be able
to show this to operators (or others) that have detailed
mode enabled and can benefit from this information being
output.

This addition makes it so that basic diagnostic information
can be obtained from the response of the healthcheck middleware
and not just OK or NOT OK; making the eventlet backdoor feature
that oslo.service provides less needed for operators.

Change-Id: I469c56586597561633921ebf3916585646f45373

subject: Avoid any body when request is a HEAD request
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-17 22:23:19.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/tests/test_healthcheck.py', 'oslo_middleware/healthcheck/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Avoid any body when request is a HEAD request

Instead of creating a body for a request that is known
to be a HEAD request avoid creating any body in the first

the health evaluation.

Closes-Bug: #1494533

Change-Id: I39abee3cdfff4af40355f91d22607e3a2aa52e29
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid any body when request is a HEAD request

Instead of creating a body for a request that is known
to be a HEAD request avoid creating any body in the first
place and just return the status code determined from
the health evaluation.

Closes-Bug: #1494533

Change-Id: I39abee3cdfff4af40355f91d22607e3a2aa52e29

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-17 21:42:39.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'oslo_middleware/tests/test_healthcheck.py', 'oslo_middleware/healthcheck/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Allow the healthcheck middleware to provide more detailed responses

It can be quite useful to have admin endpoints for healthcheck
middleware provide more information about the health of the system.

To enable this kind of information this initial step starts to
add a jinja2 template that will produce the existing simple case
by default, but when setup with detailed mode it can then produce
more information about which checks were performed and there results.

It can be expanded in the future to provide more information as
desired (possibly showing more useful application level info when
in detailed mode).

Closes-Bug: #1494531

Change-Id: I9c6dae848985d950c3cf6798695c7669eb245ccb
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the healthcheck middleware to provide more detailed responses

It can be quite useful to have admin endpoints for healthcheck
middleware provide more information about the health of the system.

To enable this kind of information this initial step starts to
add a jinja2 template that will produce the existing simple case
by default, but when setup with detailed mode it can then produce
more information about which checks were performed and there results.

It can be expanded in the future to provide more information as
desired (possibly showing more useful application level info when
in detailed mode).

Closes-Bug: #1494531

Change-Id: I9c6dae848985d950c3cf6798695c7669eb245ccb

commit_message:
Prevent ceilometer expirer from causing deadlocks

Prevents deadlocks from occurring by deleting
from each of sample, meter, resource and metadata_text
metadata_bigint, metadata_bool and metadata_float tables
in separate transactions

Closes-Bug: #1431986
Change-Id: I8670af172796e116e9c17a964063e6d86264efc6
(cherry picked from commit 7bdd0bf2c5ea97f5dd500b0e4fdaaadf6ab00889)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-25 22:15:56.000000000', 'files': ['gerritbot/channels.yaml'], 'message': 'Normalize channels.yaml

gerritbot/channels.yaml is a mix of 2- and 4-space indents.
In order to simplify programmatic manipulation of this file,
this makes all indentation 2 spaces.

In addition, it sorts the lists of projects for each channel.

This is motivated by the upcoming mass stackforge namespace renames.

commit_message:
Normalize channels.yaml

gerritbot/channels.yaml is a mix of 2- and 4-space indents.
In order to simplify programmatic manipulation of this file,
this makes all indentation 2 spaces.

In addition, it sorts the lists of projects for each channel.

This is motivated by the upcoming mass stackforge namespace renames.

Change-Id: Icfeefe5afb4cb1b73d7a82ca79892d6a01e711bd

subject: Refactor common parts of 'get_maybe_ready_for' methods
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:07:57.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/analyzer.py'], 'message': "Refactor common parts of 'get_maybe_ready_for' methods

These share quite a bit of common-like code, so refactor
both of them to share the same function and differentiate
certain provided arguments as needed.

Also tweaks the storage class 'get_atoms_states' (which
is badly named also) to not do two queries into the flow
detail when one will suffice and to not request the same
atom name twice when once will suffice.

Change-Id: Ifdf2f3efb78d189ed5a8104614b1bf6a84c9339a
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor common parts of 'get_maybe_ready_for' methods

These share quite a bit of common-like code, so refactor
both of them to share the same function and differentiate
certain provided arguments as needed.

Also tweaks the storage class 'get_atoms_states' (which
is badly named also) to not do two queries into the flow
detail when one will suffice and to not request the same
atom name twice when once will suffice.

subject: Catch exceptions raised by bad certificate plugin info
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-25 21:51:09.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/interface/test_certificate_manager.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/certificate_manager.py'], 'message': "Catch exceptions raised by bad certificate plugin info

If the Snakeoil plugin's persistent storage gets hosed or out of sync with the
Barbican database, the plugin can send information that raises an
exception.  This exception needs to be caught.  The failure is in
the plugin, so Barbican can not take guesses.  It should log the
error, cancel the action, and continue.

Change-Id: Id55eafa0dea2004bf2ab94aadb820bf08bec1468
Closes-bug: #1499768
Relates-to: #1498717
"}]
commit_message:
Catch exceptions raised by bad certificate plugin info

If the Snakeoil plugin's persistent storage gets hosed or out of sync with the
Barbican database, the plugin can send information that raises an
exception.  This exception needs to be caught.  The failure is in
the plugin, so Barbican can not take guesses.  It should log the
error, cancel the action, and continue.

Change-Id: Id55eafa0dea2004bf2ab94aadb820bf08bec1468
Closes-bug: #1499768
Relates-to: #1498717

commit_message:
Fix some spelling typo in manual and error message

wating -> waiting
acknowledgement -> acknowledgment
occured -> occurred

Should never get here. If get, then error occurred.
->
Should never get here unless an error occurred.

Change-Id: Ibe89d652e7d76b3d8e6d7549140c50c88144036e
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

subject: Further optimize cluster action
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-25 13:06:11.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/actions/cluster_action.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/actions/test_cluster_action.py'], 'message': "Further optimize cluster action

This patch further optimize the cluster action's implementation. We
don't pass cluster around, instead we save it as a property of the
action.

Change-Id: Ia9dd945ab0ad6d675f89140f602a736a134a3cd1
"}]
commit_message:
Further optimize cluster action

This patch further optimize the cluster action's implementation. We
don't pass cluster around, instead we save it as a property of the
action.

Change-Id: Ia9dd945ab0ad6d675f89140f602a736a134a3cd1
